featured.text: For an easy and 36 alternative, nutritionists suggest that we pop our own popcorn.
Then pour the popcorn into a bowl and season with a small 40 of real butter or olive oil and natural salt.

Researchers found that commercial popcorn companies often coat their microwave popcorn bags with a 33 called perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA) which has been found to cause both cancer and lung disease in laboratory animals.

other.text: Making matters worse, the artificial butter substitute that generally 34 with microwavable popcorn contains a common food-flavoring substance.
All that is 37 is a large, high pot, about four tablespoons of vegetable oil and a small handful of organic popcorn kernels.
Research by the U.S. government now reports that microwave popcorn may contain substances that can cause health 32 .

definition.zh_def: 一種用玉米粒加熱後膨脹而成的零食，通常在電影或聚會時食用。
definition.en_def: A snack made from corn kernels that puff up when heated, commonly eaten at movies or gatherings.
definition.example: I love to eat popcorn while watching a movie.
